properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 9 at 9:04AM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service In Pleasant Hill Has Issued A Hydrologic
Outlook For The Following Streams...

...Lamine River near Otterville ...Petite Saline Creek near Boonville
...Moniteau Creek near Fayette

This hydrologic outlook is based on the forecast rainfall for the
next 48 hours and estimated runoff from earlier rainfall. Crests may
vary if actual rainfall or runoff is greater or less than
anticipated.

Location: Lamine River near Otterville
Flood stage: 15.0 feet
Latest stage: 1.9 feet at 8 AM Thursday
Forecast crest: 22.0 feet Saturday Jan 11

Location: Petite Saline Creek near Boonville
Flood stage: 16.0 feet
Latest stage: 4.5 feet at 8 AM Thursday
Forecast crest: 20.0 feet Saturday Jan 11
At 19.5 feet...The creek floods U Highway about 4 miles southeast of
Boonville.

Location: Moniteau Creek near Fayette
Flood stage: 16.0 feet
Latest stage: 4.9 feet at 8 AM Thursday
Forecast crest: 19.5 feet Saturday Jan 11
At 21.0 feet...County Road 406 is under water 0.8 miles east of
Highway A.

Later statements...possibly warnings...may be issued as additional
information becomes available.
